sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Sexual Assault Evidence Submission Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Sexual Assault Evidence Submission Act.

sections.heading: Submission of evidence.  Law enforcement agencies that receive sexual assault evidence that the victim of a sexual assault or sexual abuse or a person authorized under Section 6
sections.text: 5 of the Sexual Assault Survivors Emergency Treatment Act has consented to allow law enforcement to test in connection wit

sections.heading: Failure of a law enforcement agency to submit the sexual assault evidence
sections.text: The failure of a law enforcement agency to submit the sexual assault evidence collected on or after the effective date of this Act within 10 business days after receipt shall in no way alter the authority of the law enforcem

sections.heading: Required certification.  Each submission of sexual assault evidence submitted for analysis pursuant to  this Act shall be accompanied by the following signed certification:
sections.text: Required certification. Each submission of sexual assault evidence submitted for analysis pursuant to this Act shall be accompanied by the following signed certification:

sections.heading: Expungement.  If the Illinois State Police receives written confirmation from the investigating law enforcement agency or State's Attorney's office   that a DNA record that has been uploaded pursuant to this Act into a local, State or national DNA database was not connected to a criminal investigati
sections.text: Expungement. If the Illinois State Police receives written confirmation from the investigating law enforcement agency or State's Attorney's office that a DNA record that has been uploaded pursuant to this Act into a local, State or national DNA database was not connected to a criminal investigation, the DNA record shall be expunged from the DNA database and the Illinois State Police shall, by rule, prescribe procedures to ensure that written confirmation is sent to the submitting law enforcement agency verifying the expungement.

sections.heading: Failure to expunge. The failure to expunge a DNA record or strictly comply with the provisions of Section 35 of this Act  shall not be grounds for challenging the validity of a database match or database information, and evidence based upon or derived from the DNA record may not be excluded by a cou
sections.text: Failure to expunge. The failure to expunge a DNA record or strictly comply with the provisions of Section 35 of this Act shall not be grounds for challenging the validity of a database match or database information, and evidence based upon or derived from the DNA record may not be excluded by a court.

sections.heading: Reporting. Beginning January 1, 2017 and each year thereafter, the Illinois State Police shall publish a quarterly report on its website, indicating a breakdown of the number of sexual assault case submissions from every law enforcement agency
sections.text: Reporting. Beginning January 1, 2017 and each year thereafter, the Illinois State Police shall publish a quarterly report on its website, indicating a breakdown of the number of sexual assault case submissions from every law enforcement agency.

sections.heading: Rules. The Illinois State Police shall promulgate rules that prescribe the procedures for the operation of this Act, including expunging a DNA record.
sections.text: Rules. The Illinois State Police shall promulgate rules that prescribe the procedures for the operation of this Act, including expunging a DNA record.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect September 1, 2010.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect September 1, 2010.
